newsitem.title: EL SALVADOR: El Salvador asks Venezuela to end sugar import ban.
newsitem.headline: El Salvador asks Venezuela to end sugar import ban.

text.p: The Salvadoran government asked Venezuela Wednesday to suspend a temporary import ban Caracas has slapped on sugar, a top trade minister said.
Venezuela moved to suspend sugar imports from Central American and Andean nations on September 23 because of high inventories already existing in domestic warehouses.

El Salvador's Rolando Alvarenga, the deputy minister for trade and industry, said Wednesday the imports were not adversely affecting Venezuela's domestic sugar industry and criticised Venezuela for going back on a 1986 sugar pact allowing the duty-free imports.
In 1992, El Salvador exported 5,000 tonnes of sugar to Venezuela and by 1995 exports had risen to 31,952 tonnes, a spokesman for the Economy Ministry said.
The ban affects imports not only from El Salvador, but also from Guatemala, Nicaragua, Colombia, Ecuador and Bolivia.
